(India). A Deputy General Manager earns an average salary of Rs 1,718,033 per year. Most people in this job have more than five years' experience in related jobs. Pay for this job rises steadily for more experienced workers, but goes down noticeably for employees with more than 20 years' experience. The skills that increase pay for this job the most are Telecommunications, Strategic Planning, and Engineering Design. X Total Pay combines base annual salary or hourly wage, bonuses, profit sharing, tips, commissions, overtime pay and other forms of cash earnings, as applicable for this job. It does not include equity (stock) compensation, cash value of retirement benefits, or the value of other non-cash benefits (e.g. healthcare).

Our team of Certified Compensation Professionals has analyzed survey data collected from thousands of HR departments at companies of all sizes and industries to present this range of annual salaries for people with the job title Project Engineering Manager in the United States. This chart describes the expected percentage of people who perform the job of Project Engineering Manager that make less than that salary. For example 50% of the people who perform the job of Project Engineering Manager are expected to make less than the median.

For example the median expected annual pay for a typical Project Engineering Manager in the United States is $116,766, so 50% of the people who perform the job of Project Engineering Manager in the United States are expected to make less than $116,766. Project Manager, Engineering Salary. (United States). The national average salary for Engineering Project Managers is $85K per year; Chevron Corporation pays the most in this field, though, offering a median salary of $171K. Apple Computer, Inc, Schlumberger, and Jacobs Engineering Group Inc also offer top salaries for Engineering Project Managers. For Engineering Project Managers, Houston provides a pay rate that is 25 percent greater than the national average. Engineering Project Managers will also find cushy salaries in Los Angeles (+14 percent), Denver (+7 percent), Boston (+6 percent), and Pittsburgh (+2 percent).
